title: Man left dangling upside-down from 270ft Dixon's Chimney as 'clothes get stuck'
text:
A man has been left dangling upside-down from the top of a 270ft chimney for more than 10 hours as the emergency services deployed a helicopter in an attempt to rescue him.

Police, fire and ambulance have been scrambled to the scene, with a helicopter hovering near the top of Dixon's Chimney in Carlisle, Cumbria.

Footage from the scene appears to show a figure, upside down with his legs in the air, at the top of the chimney.

Locals reported the rescue operation was launched at around 2.20am on Monday. Roads around the structure, built in 1836 and a prominent local landmark, have been closed.

Witnesses said shouts and wailing could be heard coming from the chimney in the early hours of this morning before police arrived on the scene, according to local reports.

He is said to be dangling by his clothes, but appears to be topless. The fire service have also released a desperate plea asking for anyone with a large cherry picker to get in touch with them.

Emergency services have used helicopters and drones in their attempt to bring the man down safely.

The helicopter approach was abandoned due to fears the downdraft would blow the man from the chimney as police said they would revert to trying to reach him from below.

Reports suggest police have talked to the man on Monday morning, suggesting he is still alive.
